title: Flora-Bama 11th Annual Bulls On The Beach
location: Flora-Bama Lounge Package & Oyster Bar 17401 Perdido Key Dr. Perdido Key, FL. 32507
description:
Get your tickets early because Bulls On The Beach is one of Flora-Bama's most anticipated events of the year! Bring the family out to experience the ultimate adrenaline rush with three nights of live rodeo action featuring Professional Bull Riders from all around the country! A portion of the proceeds from this event will go to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

Join us Thursday for Kid's Night! Kids 12 and under can participate in a Coloring Contest Bike Giveaway for both a lucky little boy and girl (scroll down for more info), followed by Professional Bull Riding to round out the night. Friday and Saturday night will feature the Professional Bull Riders in the adult Bull Riding Competition. We look forward to seeing you there!

title: 25/26 Leadership Perdido Key - Class 2 Local Government
location: Session Schedule Regular sessions are scheduled from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. They will be held in different locations based on the class session topic. 2025 Opening Reception - August 21 Local Government - September 10 Tourism - October 8 Environment - November 12 Military - December 10 2026 Education & Healthcare January 14 Graduation/Annual Dinner January 20 Class project - TBD While we try to keep sessions consistent, sessions are subject to change depending on unforeseen planning conflicts.
description:
Leaders are not born; they are developed. We must ensure the success of our community by cultivating talented individuals who will emerge and lead us into the future. There is no better training ground for our future leaders than Leadership Perdido Key (LPK). The keys to the future of Northwest Florida are knowledgeable and skilled leaders who have an awareness and understanding of all facets of our community, including local government, business, tourism/hospitality, environment, military, and more.



Leadership Perdido Key is a comprehensive leadership development program designed to empower individuals with the skills, knowledge, and networking needed to become effective leaders in their communities. 

Participants in Leadership Perdido Key will come from diverse backgrounds and industries, reflecting the community's rich tapestry of talent and expertise. Through a series of workshops, seminars, and experiential learning activities, participants have the opportunity to deepen their understanding of Perdido Key area and hone their leadership capabilities.

The program will feature guest speakers who are prominent leaders in various fields, providing valuable insights.  Additionally, participants may engage in hands-on projects and community initiatives aimed at making a positive impact in Perdido Key and surrounding areas.

Overall, Leadership Perdido Key aims to cultivate a new generation of leaders who are equipped to address the challenges and opportunities facing their communities, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and service.



Click here to download information & application packet

Application deadline is August 1, 2025



Sponsorship information

 
The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce extends its congratulations to the following individuals selected for the 2025-26 Leadership Perdido Key class:


	Alicia Popper, Pensacola Habitat for Humanity
	Amanda Long, Pointe South
	Cheyenne Sherbundy, Alexander Hines Construction, LLC
	Cinnamon Swift, Pirates of Lost Treasure & Secret Santa
	Clay Hines, Alexander Hines Construction, LLC
	Clayton Wissmann, CoastEase
	Juli Meyer, Flora-Bama
	Kaila Parker, Reliance Mortgage
	Karla Boyd, Holiday Harbor Marina
	Katy Novak, Perdido Realty Vacations
	Kendall Loper
	Lauren Brown, Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce
	Ronald Rivera, Escambia County Sheriff's Office
	Sadie O'Gara, Lost Key Group- Levin Rinke Realty
	Steve Stroberger, Escambia County D1 County Commissioner
	Tony Tampary, Escambia County Sheriff's Office

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "Starting a Business"
location: Greater Pensacola Chamber of Commerce 418 W Garden St, CO:LAB Bldg, 4th flr Pensacola, FL 32501
description:
So you've got that business idea. You may not know the first steps, or you may want some guidance on if you're taking the right steps. Let's work with the ideas that have been forming in your head and see if we can make them into a tangible, feasible small business. In this three-hour workshop, we'll take a deep dive into the following aspects of setting up a successful business:

 


	Is there a need for your product or service?
	Can you make money at it?
	Are you the right person to bring this to market?
	Is this business compatible with your personal goals?
	What rules, laws, and licensing apply to your business?
	What are funding options for your business?
	What about marketing strategies, legal structures, and taxation?
	What are your available resources?


Also, after attending this workshop you'll have access to a Florida SBDC Business Consultant to assist you at no cost as you create your business plan and move toward your goals!

 

*UWF students and employees may attend SBDC workshops at no cost. Contact us at 850-474-2528 to register with your Nautilus Card number.

 

Please note: No refund credit without 48-hour notice. Contact us at sbdc@uwf.edu or 850-474-2528 with questions.

 

Brought to you in part by Wells Fargo.

title: 2025 Perdido Palooza Community Party
location: Warrior Beer Company 10605 Sorrento Rd, Pensacola, FL 32507
description:
Perdido Palooza is a vibrant monthly community party that brings people together in a fun, festive atmosphere! Hosted by the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce and Warrior Beer Company, this event is designed to celebrate the spirit and charm of the Perdido community! Held from May through October, each month features live performances from talented musicians, craft beer, local food trucks, and a strong focus on supporting the community through partnerships with local businesses and artisans.

 

What to Expect at Perdido Palooza:

  Enjoy live music

   Shop & visit with local vendors and businesses 

  Savor craft beer brewed on-site by Warrior Beer Company

  Connect with friends, neighbors, and the community while supporting local talent and our local businesses.

 

When: The second Thursday of every month, from May through October.



Interested in being a part of the event? Check out the sponsorship information and the vendor information here!

 

Celebrate local, enjoy the best of Perdido Key, and join us at Perdido Palooza for an unforgettable experience. Let's raise a glass to community, music, food, and fun!

 

FUTURE DATES: 

OCTOBER 9
 



All sales are final and non-refundable. The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce will not be responsible for reselling your booth space if you are unable to attend.



By attending this event, you consent to photography, video recording, and its/their release, publication, or reproduction to be used by the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce for promotional purposes, including on social media, websites, and other marketing materials.

 

All sponsorships and booth spaces must be paid 30 days before the event date

location: 1000 College Blvd, Pensacola, FL 32504 Building 11 Room 1101
description: Learn more about the Pensacola State College Charter Academy! Join us at one of our information sessions to discover how students in grades 9-12 can earn a high school diploma AND college credits simultaneously for FREE! Only 75 seats are available per grade level, so secure your spot before it's too late.

title: September Business After Hours 2025
location: Perdido Key Sports Bar 13583 Perdido Key Drive Perdido Key, FL 32507
description:
The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce invites all members and future members to our monthly Business After Hours, a fantastic perk of Chamber membership and a great way to build connections in the community!

This energetic networking event is held from 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM at a different host location each month, providing the perfect opportunity to meet fellow professionals in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.

September's Business After Hours will take place at:

Perdido Key Sports Bar

13583 Perdido Key Drive

Perdido Key, FL 32507

Enjoy light hors d'oeuvres, generously provided by our host, as you mingle and expand your network. Be sure to bring your business cards for networking and prize drawings door prize donations are always welcome!
Fees/Admission:

Free for Chamber Members   One of the many benefits of being part of our Chamber!

$5 for Future Members   A great way to explore the benefits of joining.

We can't wait to see you there! Registration is highly encouraged to help our hosts prepare.

title: Ambassadors of the Key Committee Meeting
location: Perdido Key Breakfast Club
description:
Ambassadors of the Key Committee Meeting

3rd Friday Monthly | 11:30AM | Perdido Key Breakfast Club



Ambassador meetings are held once a month on the 3rd Friday at 11:30 AM at a different member restaurant each month. These meetings provide a great opportunity to connect, share updates, and collaborate on upcoming Chamber initiatives. Each Ambassador is responsible for the purchase of their own meal.



The Ambassadors of the Key serve as the welcoming arm of the Perdido Chamber, focusing on member recruitment, retention, and engagement. This dedicated group of business and individual members acts as the connectors within our chamber community. They work to help members get plugged in by introducing them to fellow business professionals, Chamber events, and valuable resources.



Ambassadors help create a welcoming environment for new and existing members, assist with Chamber-hosted events, and work to increase visibility and engagement. Ambassadors try to ensure that every member feels welcomed, informed, and empowered to make the most of their Chamber membership.



For more information on how to become an Ambassador of the Key, contact Madelyn Bell, Membership Engagement & Events Director at 850.492.4660 or membership@perdidochamber.com.

title: Level Up Your Listing
location: Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce
description:
Level Up Your Listing

Sponsored by Lillian's Pizza | Lunch Provided



Ready to take your Chamber listing to the next level? This interactive session will show you how to update and optimize your Member Information Center profile so your business shines. Learn the tips and tricks that make your listing stand out, improve your SEO, and drive more visibility to your business.



What You'll Learn:

	How to fully update and complete your listing for maximum impact.
	Best practices for enhanced listings highlighting your business with photos, logos, and keywords.
	SEO-friendly strategies to boost your listing in searches.
	How to use additional tools like posting events, deals, and job openings to gain more exposure.

Who Should Attend:


	Business owners and primary representatives.
	Team members who manage your Chamber profile.
	Anyone looking to get the most out of their Chamber membership.

Pro tip: Bring your phone, tablet, or laptop for hands-on learning!

Take advantage of this opportunity to connect, learn, and grow with your Chamber community. Registration is required reserve your spot today!

title: Brown Bag Lunch Series - Learn the Signs of Scams before it Happens to You.
location: Perdido Key Chamber of Commerce 15500 Perdido Key Dr. Community Center.
description:
Learn the Signs of Scams Before it Happens to You.
Knowledge is your best defense against fraud. Join us and the Better Business Bureau for this informative session presented by Will Wirth. Discover how to recognize scams and protect yourself from becoming a victim. You'll learn about some of the most common tactics scammers use, the red flags to watch out for, and practical steps you can take to keep your money and personal information safe.



 Will Wirth is the Marketing & Communications Director for the BBB serving Northwest Florida. He joined the BBB of 

 NWFL in August 2023 and has since been active in community engagement (presentations and speaking engagements),

 exhibitions, chamber events and the local FPRA chapter. He oversees the BBB's marketing with social media, press

 releases, website updates, digital advertising, and media appearances. He graduated from the University of West

 Florida with my BA in Communication Arts. I am also a big sports fan rooting for the UWF Argonauts, Florida Gators (Go

 GATORS!), New England Patriots (AFC), New Orleans Saints (NFC), and the Carolina Hurricanes (NHL   Formerly

 Hartford Whalers).
